website_summaries.verdict: This protein-packed ferret food is loaded with the high-end meats, vitamins, and minerals a ferret needs, and if you can look past the price, this premium option is certainly worth your consideration.
pros: Chicken organs, pea flour, chicken, and menhaden fish meal are the first 4 ingredients
cons: This meaty ferret food is a pretty expensive blend, but the quality protein sources surely drive up the price

customer_reviews.title: PEA FLOUR
customer_reviews.text: Caused bladder stones in my ferrets due to PEA FLOUR! Guess the "Largest Ferret Breeder" just wants to kill your current ferrets so you buy more from them. DO NOT BUY THIS FOOD
customer_reviews.author: Carissa

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT FEED THIS TO YOUR FERRET
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed that a company that breeds ferrets is selling this!! It should not be amazons choice AT ALL! This food contains pea flour which is a plant based protein and causes bladder stones! I am currently waiting for a call from my vets office to pick up my poor ferret. He has so many bladder stones and they are lined up throughout his urethra. Around $1000 I’m paying for his surgery and not to mention I just wasted $20 on a bag of this food the other day. I will be getting a refund! This is ridiculous. DO NOT PURCHASE IF YOU LOVE YOUR FERRETS!
customer_reviews.author: mckenzie

customer_reviews.title: Healthy happy ferrets
customer_reviews.text: Ferrets love this. Nice soft thick hair. Very healthy. Always buy this through Amazon. Can't find this in California pet shops.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Ferret approved
customer_reviews.text: He is in love with this flavor he won't eat the original anymore. Thank you for helping me spoil my fur baby
customer_reviews.author: Heaven

customer_reviews.title: Ferrets like it
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is cheaper than store it’s still a lot of $ for small bags
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you love your ferrets
customer_reviews.text: My sweet boy now has bladder stones from this food, pea flour is the second ingredient in this which is known to cause bladder stones. Do not buy this food unless you enjoy watching your little one cry when he pees blood and a pile of rocks. Update: my ferret required very expensive ($1500) life saving surgery to clear his bladder stones. He was literally within hours of a terrible death without it. Vet confirmed this food was the culprit.
customer_reviews.author: Virago

customer_reviews.title: Please do not buy for your ferrets
customer_reviews.text: Contains pea flour, which has been shown to cause bladder stones in ferrets. We learned this the hard way after a $2,000 operation to have them removed from our boy.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Paul Sailer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect! thank you - i soak in broth, she loves it
customer_reviews.author: P. Owens

customer_reviews.title: this was a great diet change for our older ferrets who had lost ...
customer_reviews.text: this was a great diet change for our older ferrets who had lost some weight over the years gained back a pound or two and energy
customer_reviews.author: Charles Menzel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Food is fresh and arrives on time best ferret food for your ferret
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Ferrets are looking a bit healthier and the cats love to steal it
customer_reviews.author: Mollie

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Not the healthiest on the market but ferrets like it
customer_reviews.author: Deb C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy anything else for my ferrets. Always fast shipping to.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle the Squaw

customer_reviews.title: I like this product
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. I've noticed since using this product that my ferrets coat looks healthier, and he seems to like the taste. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jammie C.

customer_reviews.title: Crunch Crunch
customer_reviews.text: My baby does not seem to be bothered by the pea flour as she has been eating this for almost a year. She has the most beautiful coat of fur!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Fat, Happy and Healthy Stinky Slinkies
customer_reviews.text: For years I've mixed Marshall Carnivore, Chicken and Zupreem grain free to feed my babies. They also get their soupies nightly with and egg thrown in once a week. Almost all my little ones lived to be 8 yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Will cause your ferret an early and painful death
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT FEED THIS TO YOUR FERRETS!!! It will cause bladder stones. Please be an informed buyer, read the ingredients list!! This will cause your ferret health problems, it might not be immediate, but it will contribute to an early and painful death.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.CorryTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Pea flour causes near fatal bladder stones in ferrets
customer_reviews.text: NEVER buy any product with pea flour in it for your ferret! I'm shocked that even though vets are passing this information on to food companies, they still are using this. Pea flour causes bladder stones in ferrets. My ferret was in terrible pain and had to be rushed in for emergency surgery one night. He almost died because his urethra was totally blocked with stones. This should be taken off the market as should any other ferret food with pea flour as an ingredient. Horrible!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning!  Possibly dangerous for your ferrets!
customer_reviews.text: This ferret food contains WAY too high of an amount of pea protein for ferrets! Check online, check with a qualified ferret vet, and you will see that too many ferrets eating this food have developed seriously life threatening bladder stones! These bladder stones must be surgically removed ($$$). I would never purchase Marshall's cheap food, there are much better quality (high meat protein) cat/kitten foods that are much healthier for your little weasels.
customer_reviews.author: Ange

customer_reviews.title: My ferret died due to bladdar stones.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this food was a good one, I did not do enough research. Our little guy was only 7 months old and had a 4mm bladder stone that got lodged in his urethra. There was nothing the vet could do and our guy passed. Please do not buy this food for your ferret.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ESA ferret DIED because of this food
customer_reviews.text: I wish we could give ZERO stars! This food KILLED my friend’s ESA ferret! :( :( :( Keep your little ones away from this.
customer_reviews.author: Doodles21

customer_reviews.title: pea flour?
customer_reviews.text: I would worry about the pea flour and ferrets. Check on-line and decide for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Hylton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: not their favorite food, but higher in protein than than other foods and they are finicky eaters
customer_reviews.author: steele rage

product_meta.title: Marshall Pet Products Carnivore Plus Ferret Diet
product_meta.description: Size:3.5 lbMarshall Carnivore Plus High Protein Diet Ferret Food - 3.5 lb
feature_bullets: Premium diet food is grain-free and comes in the form of pellets for an immediate breakdown in the digestive system
This food is perfect for ferrets because of their strict meat-based protein diet
Each pellet is made with a low heat, and slow cooking process to preserve amino acids and vitamins
Added vitamins, minerals and amino acids can help provide a healthier immune system
Grain free, gluten free, and wheat free
